instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Hi i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with a charging issue, laptop will boot to login screen, shows battery percentage and charging icon but as soon as you enter the password and hit enter the laptop restarts, if i disconect the battery it will boot to os, it will not turn on by battery power either, so ive changed <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> checked current sensing both charging side and battery side and just out of frustration changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, oh and also reset pram just incase :-( anybody got any clues

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging issue
threads.message: Make sure you are using an ORIGINAL REAL 85W charger, none of that China crap! After that it is probably a bad battery.
